intro: Lannea rubra, commonly known as the red lannea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically red when ripe, and contains a single seed. Lannea rubra is often found in dry woodlands and is adapted to arid conditions.
